intro_text: The patrol is on edge after scenting Twolegs in the area. p_l takes the lead, keeping watch for any Twolegs that may be on the hunt for cats. Their scent is everywhere, even as the cats carefully remark the area. What's that smell? It's almost like pumpkin, but strange...
decline_text: p_l knows better than to mess with anything that smells like Twolegs. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/skirt/skirts} around the area and {VERB/p_l/continue/continues} the patrol.

success_outcomes.text: p_l follows the scent and nearly treads on the sticky thing in the grass. Definitely a weird Twoleg thing. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} carefully {VERB/p_l/walk/walks} around it, unwilling to get the sticky stuff in {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} fur.

p_l finds the sticky thing in the grass and examines it. s_c suddenly appears beside {PRONOUN/p_l/object} and, before p_l can tell {PRONOUN/s_c/object} to be careful, s_c bends down and takes a lick. s_c wrinkles {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} nose and gags, trying to spit the disgusting taste out of {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} mouth.

log.cats_from: from_cat was impressed by to_cat's boldness in tasting a Twoleg object.
Bold or not, from_cat thinks to_cat was mouse-brained to taste the Twoleg object.

fail_outcomes.text: As p_l creeps closer to get a better look, the sound of crashing and chattering fills the air. p_l freezes and watches a pack of Twolegs stumble through the trees. The cats scatter, leaving behind whatever that weird thing was in the grass.

log.cats_from: from_cat watched to_cat freeze up on a patrol {PRONOUN/to_cat/subject} {VERB/to_cat/were/was} leading.
